newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish debt yields fall after Dublin, repo hopes.
newsitem.headline: Swedish debt yields fall after Dublin, repo hopes.

text.p: Swedish debt yields fell on Monday on goods news about the EU stability-pact as well as positive expectations about the Riksbank's inflation report and repo operation, both due on Tuesday.
According to a Reuter survey, nine out 14 economists predicted the central bank would cut the repo rate by 25 basis points to 4.10 percent.
* Six-month T-bill rates fell five basis points to 3.81 pct
* Ten-year bond yields fell six basis points to 6.89 pct
* Crown gained to 4.3950 to the mark vs 4.4000 late Friday

STOCKHOLM, Dec 16 (Reuter) - The mood of Swedish debt markets on Monday was optimistic due to the EU-decision on the stability-pact at the weekend as well as expectations of an upbeat inflation report and a cut in the repo rate on Tuesday.

The Riksbank will present its final inflation report for the year and announce a repo operation that will run three weeks to cover the holiday period. A Reuter poll found expectations for a 25 basis point cut to 4.10 percent.
"The yields will probably be stay around today's levels on Tuesday if the Riksbank does not cut the repo rate by more or less than expected," one dealer said.
Six-month T-bill rates fell five basis points to 3.81 percent and ten-year bond yields by six to 6.89 percent.
The trade in the crown was steady despite expectations the crown would strengthen considerably against the mark.
"The mark was strong against the lira and the French franc and that stopped the crown from further strengthening," one dealer said. "But I think the crown will strengthen against the mark tomorrow."
The crown gained a little to 4.3950 against the mark versus 4.4000 late Friday.
